li.xref: Conduits- an overview, and in-depth coverage of sources

conbody.p: To give a basic overview: you use runResourceT to run a Resource block, which ensures all allocated resources are freed. The conduit package always lives inside a Resource block, which ensures that resources are freed. Sources produce data, sinks consume data, and conduits transform data. You can fuse conduits into sources, into sinks, or with other conduits. And finally, you can connect a source to a sink to produce a result.
That should be enough information to cover this post, though reading the previous posts- and especially the second one- is highly recommended.
